title: Adelaide perverted man offered a four-year-old boy a lollipop in a park to lure him away from mother
text:
A stranger made 'suggestive' comments to a four-year-old boy and tried to lure him away from his parents in a park using a lollipop.

Police are now investigating the unknown man after the incident at St Kilda adventure playground in Adelaide.

It's understood the man approached the boy while his mother couldn't see him through the busy school holiday crowd on Monday at 5pm.

The man approached the boy while his mother couldn't see him through the busy school holiday crowd at St Kilda adventure playground in Adelaide (pictured)

After two minutes of searching, the woman found her son, who told her the concerning story of what had transpired.

'He says he was approached by a tall blonde man who offered him a lollipop', the boy's mother told 9NEWS.

'When my son told him to go away, the man made a very inappropriate and suggestive comment… before running off when he heard me screaming my son's name.'

Police confirmed they are looking into the matter, while Salisbury Council has given authorities full access to CCTV footage.
description: A stranger made 'suggestive' comments to a four-year-old boy and tried to lure him away from his mother in an Adelaide park using a lollipop.
authors: Alana Mazzoni For Daily Mail Australia
